alert.note: Alert for Avery (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 16 at 6:56AM EST until January 17 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 to 15 below zero, with minus 20 along the highest ridge tops. * WHERE...Avery County. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to noon EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken. If you must venture outdoors, make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
